CatDescriptText: Miss Loretta Edwards, nurse, Hill, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 24, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think Pittsburgh Negroes are justified in being angry at the failure of city officials to appoint a Negro as police inspector, in spite of repeated appeals to grant them representation at this level of law enforcement?" Answer reads: "I do. The only way we can get anything is to keep after them.  If we protest, it might help."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Loretta Edwards wearing light colored round collared coat with large buttons, standing in front of store window displaying shoes and gloves
